title: 452: Nu Wii U
description: Sony finally reveals its new Playstation Portal device, and it’s exactly as underwhelming as everyone suspected it would be. Then, Apple supports California’s latest Right to Repair bill — but to what end? Then, Fyre Festival 2 is happening somewhere in the Carribbean. And if you’re one of the lucky 100 who bought tickets, boy do we want to hear from you!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort
excerpt: Sony finally reveals its new Playstation Portal device, and it’s exactly as underwhelming as everyone suspected it would be. Then, Apple supports California’s latest Right to Repair bill. Then, Fyre Festival 2 is happening somewhere in the Carribbean.
text: #452: Nu Wii U August 24th, 2023 · 57 minutes Sony finally reveals its new Playstation Portal device, and it’s exactly as underwhelming as everyone suspected it would be. Then, Apple supports California’s latest Right to Repair bill. Then, Fyre Festival 2 is happening somewhere in the Carribbean. Stream this episode Links and Show Notes Sony PlayStation Portal streaming handheld price announced - Polygon PlayStation’s first Remote Play dedicated device, PlayStation Portal remote player, to launch later this year at $199.99 – PlayStation.Blog Sony’s portable PlayStation Portal launches later this year for $199.99 - The Verge Apple now supports California’s right-to-repair bill after lobbying against it - The Verge Fyre Festival 2, anyone? Billy McFarland says tickets have sold out. - The Washington Post Fyre Festival 2 tickets are now on sale -- and selling out -- according to embattled founder Billy McFarland | CNN Fyre Festival II Tickets Are on Sale, Says Billy McFarland – Rolling Stone How to Be Yourself? – Caroline Calloway, Tara Isabella Burton, and Katherine Dee on Online Self-Creation – SuperSalon - Interintellect Relay FM 10th Anniversary Extravaganza - Hackney Empire
html:
#452: Nu Wii U

August 24th, 2023 · 57 minutes

Sony finally reveals its new Playstation Portal device, and it’s exactly as underwhelming as everyone suspected it would be. Then, Apple supports California’s latest Right to Repair bill. Then, Fyre Festival 2 is happening somewhere in the Carribbean.

Stream this episode

Apple now supports California’s right-to-repair bill after lobbying against it - The Verge
